page.title: 12GROVEBURY FARM, LEIGHTON
page.content: Grovebury Farm is situated between Billington and Leighton. The farmer's family have rented the farm from the council for twenty years. It is mainly an arable farm, covering an area of 380 acres which is divided into twenty fields. There are five buildings on the farm, a grain store, a tractor shed, a cattle building, a calf house and a farm house. The crops grown are wheat, barley, oil seed rape and grass. They are harvested between July and September which is a very busy time on the farm. They use some of the crops to make cattle food and the remainder is sold to local merchants. There are about two hundred cattle on the farm, mainly of the Simmental breed and are used for beef. Some of the calves are bred on the farm but others are bought at market.
